Wait, what was the bug? The one where the inline decouplers wouldn't detach when decoupled?
What exactly was wrong with them?

> 
> What exactly was wrong with them?

They decoupled stuff with enough uneven force that whatever was decoupled would invariable spin, top heavy, against the rest of the craft. Often times causing an Unplanned Rapid Disassembly of the entire rocket on the way up. It didn't matter how carefully you positioned the attached item - the only fix was for Sepatrons to counteract the tendency, and even that was iffy, sometimes.

I haven't seen the SQUADcast, but I'd assume it's the bug where parts would start to rotate their top inwards right after being decoupled when radial decouplers were used. See following video at about 2:10.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fMKWqxJ-z9I?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

It's one of the things fixed using [Stock Bugfix Modules](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-0-25-Stock-Bug-Fix-Modules).
